intro: Calochortus umpquaensis, commonly known as the Umpqua mariposa, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the genus Calochortus, which includes a variety of flowering plants commonly referred to as mariposas. This species is characterized by its showy, cup-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink and yellow. It typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. Calochortus umpquaensis is an important plant for local ecosystems, providing nectar for pollinators and contributing to biodiversity.
